name: Leonardo da Vinci

sampleWorks.description: A portrait of a woman, widely regarded as the most famous painting in the world.
Depicts Jesus and his disciples at the Last Supper.
A drawing of a man in two superimposed positions with his arms and legs apart.
A portrait of a young woman, likely Ginevra de' Benci.

bio: Leonardo da Vinci was an Italian painter, draftsman, sculptor, architect, and engineer whose genius epitomized the Renaissance humanist ideal.

name: Vincent van Gogh

sampleWorks.description: A swirling depiction of a night sky filled with stars.
A series of paintings featuring vibrant yellow sunflowers.
A painting of vibrant blue irises with a single white iris.

bio: Vincent van Gogh was a Dutch painter, known for his bold colors and emotional depth in paintings.

name: Pablo Picasso

sampleWorks.description: A large mural depicting the horrors of war.
A controversial painting of five nude women with disjointed body shapes.
A powerful portrayal of a woman in distress.
A young woman looking at her reflection in the mirror.

bio: Pablo Picasso was a Spanish artist and one of the most influential figures in 20th-century art, co-founding the Cubist movement.

name: Claude Monet

sampleWorks.description: Part of a series depicting Monet's flower garden at Giverny.
The painting that gave rise to the name of the Impressionist movement.
A series of paintings of the facade of Rouen Cathedral under different light conditions.
A painting of a footbridge in Monet's water garden in Giverny.

bio: Claude Monet was a French painter, a founder of the Impressionist movement, famous for his landscape and nature paintings.
